cont.entity_a: Very balanced, clean, and clear sound with little coloration. Upper frequencies and voices are more detailed and sweeter compared to Audio Technica ATH-M50s. Capable of very deep bass, but more than present in the recording requires EQ adjustment. Sound quality is spectacular when used with a FiiO A3 amp with bass boost. Sound is clear without sibilance and has a strong but not excessive bass. Sound is neutral with a flat response, suitable for mixing. Great sound reproduction, especially for studio use. Great for mixing and monitoring music.
cont.entity_b: Good sound quality but has very prominent treble compared to weak bass. Superb sound with a unique look.

cont.entity_a: Phones fit comfortably over ears and offer a nice sound barrier to exterior noises. Very comfortable even for long periods. Sturdy build and comfortable for long hours of use.
cont.entity_b: Most comfortable clip-on headphones owned. Secure and comfortable clip-on attachments. Earpieces pinch after extended wear.
Great sound quality at a great price.

cont.entity_a: Durable build quality, withstands rough use and travel. Reliable over many years with minor repairs needed.
cont.entity_b: Thin cables may raise durability concerns. Durability issues with some units breaking after first use.
Only one cord retracts, limiting convenience. Retractable mechanism works well and prevents tangling.

cont.entity_a: Cord is well made and sturdy. Coiled cord stretches out surprisingly long. Non-detachable coiled cable. Coiled cord can be a nuisance due to its length.
cont.entity_b: Cord is too short, requiring an extension for usefulness. Retractable cord is a nice feature.

cont.entity_a: Phones fit comfortably over ears and offer a nice sound barrier to exterior noises.
cont.entity_b: Fit around the ear is loose, affecting sound quality.

cont.entity_a: Not noise-canceling but blocks out most external noise.
Arrived well packaged including a plug adapter and carrying bag.
Sturdy build and comfortable for long hours of use.
Replacement ear pads are necessary as stock ones degrade over time.
